alert.note: Alert for Greene; Polk (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 05 at 2:04AM CDT until May 05 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN GREENE AND SOUTHERN POLK COUNTIES... At 204 AM CDT, Emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ash Grove, Walnut Grove, Pleasant Hope, Morrisville, Aldrich, Sacville, Brighton and Eudora. This includes the following low water crossings... Slagle Creek at 86 Road, Deer Creek at Highway YY, Turkey Creek at Highway W, Asher Creek at 560 Road and Sims Branch at Highway CC. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
